intro: Homalobus junceus, commonly known as the slender grass. It is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family.
